item.title: On absolutely continuous spectrum for one-channel unitary operators
item.description: arXiv:2405.08898v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper, we develop the radial transfer matrix formalism for unitary one-channel operators. This generalizes previous formalisms for CMV matrices and scattering zippers. We establish an analog of Carmona's formula and deduce criteria for absolutely continuous spectrum which we apply to random Hilbert Schmidt perturbations of periodic scattering zippers.
item.dc:creator: Olivier Bourget, Gregorio Moreno, Christian Sadel, Amal Taarabt

item.title: Local strong magnetic fields and the Little-Parks effect
item.description: arXiv:2405.09099v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Starting from the Ginzburg--Landau model in a planar simply connected domain, with a local compactly supported applied magnetic field, we derive an effective model in the strong field limit, defined on a non-simply connected domain. The effective model features oscillations in the Little-Parks and Aharonov--Bohm spirit. We discuss also a similar question for the lowest eigenvalue of the magnetic Laplacian.
item.dc:creator: Ayman Kachmar, Mikael Sundqvist

item.title: The full delocalization of eigenstates for the quantized cat map
item.description: arXiv:2103.06633v4 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We consider the quantum cat map - a toy model of a quantized chaotic system. We show that its eigenstates are fully delocalized on $\mathbb{T}^2$ in the semiclassical limit (or equivalently that each semiclassical measure is fully supported on $\mathbb{T}^2$). We adapt the proof of a similar result proved for the eigenstates of $-\Delta_g$ on compact hyperbolic surfaces from [arXiv:1705.05019], relying on the fractal uncertainty principle in [arXiv:1612.09040].
item.dc:creator: Nir Schwartz

item.title: Defect bound states in the continuum without symmetry protection: bilayer graphene and beyond
item.description: arXiv:2312.16844v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We analyze a class of bound defect states in the continuum of bilayer graphene, which emerge independent of symmetry protection or additional degrees of freedom. A comparative analysis of AA- and AB-stacked bilayer graphene demonstrates that these states originate from the intrinsic algebraic structure of the Hamiltonian rather than any underlying symmetry. This discovery provides a pathway to previously unexplored approaches in defect and band-structure engineering. We conclude with a proposed protocol for observing these states in scanning tunneling microscopy experiments.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Massatt, Stephen P. Shipman, Ilya Vekhter, Justin H. Wilson
